RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 12500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANZ TILL TEN was prominent in the early running and was forwardly placed into the first turn, stalked the decent pace through the backstretch run, was given his cue entering the far turn and collared the pacesetter nearing the quarter marker while two wide, took command into the drive, was kept to task to mid-stretch, drove clear into deep stretch and was geared down in the final stages. FANTASTIC DREAM was unhurried in the early going, maintained a three wide path into the backstretch run then slipped to the rail heading into the second turn, was guided off of the rail nearing the top of the lane and came four wide into the stretch, could not impact the winner in the final stages but closed well late and held safely in the end for the place. BALLROOM PRINCE broke a step slowly and settled outside of rivals in the early running, raced widest into the backstretch run then was steered two wide into the far turn, was coaxed along three wide into the lane, could not muster the needed late response and was outfinished for the show. UPDRAFT settled off of the moderate pace while saving ground, saved all of the ground to the far turn and did not offer a late rally. THECHIEFHASTRICKS was hustled leaving the break and assumed command in the early stages, set decent fractions through the backstretch run, came under pressure along the far turn and was overtaken by DANZ TILL TEN, chased the winner to mid-stretch and gave way in the final stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Thechiefhastricks
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,set pace,overtaken 1/4,chased stretch,gave way late

ENTRY.NAME: Updraft
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,no late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Danz Till Ten
ENTRY.COMMENT: forward,stalked 2wide,bid 1/4,clear 1/8,geared down late

ENTRY.NAME: Fantastic Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried,3wide early,4wide into stretch,closed for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Ballroom Prince
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,tracked outside,3wide into stretch,outkicked

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 89. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 14000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $4,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $8,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCY TREASURE was sent to be prominent in the early running, contested the early pace with HER PERFECT VISION then ceded the lead to that rival into the turn, raced close to the solid pace along the bend then took command nearing the top of the stretch, drew to a clear lead approaching the furlong marker, was kept to task into deep stretch and maintained a clear advantage to the wire. AUSTRIAN NAVY chased the early pace from the rail, saved ground along the bend then was angled three wide for the drive, rallied inside of the furlong marker, could not impact the winner in the final stages and stayed on to best the rest. DON'T TELL HYDEE chased the solid early pace while between rivals, maintained a two wide path to the quarter marker, ran evenly to the furlong grounds, failed to produce the needed late kick and was clear in the end for the show. PERFECTLY JULIE chased outside of rivals in the early stages, raced three wide into the turn, drifted out to the four path nearing the quarter marker, ran evenly to the furlong marker and did not offer a late response. HER PERFECT VISION showed good early speed, contested the pace outside of LUCY TREASURE then took command nearing the turn, drifted out along the bend and came under pressure nearing the quarter marker, lost the lead to LUCY TREASURE approaching the top of the lane, chased from the four path to mid-stretch and faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Austrian Navy
ENTRY.OWNER: Huntertown Farm LLC and Calvario Samuel
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,angled 3wide upper,rallied,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Tell Hydee
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased between 2wide,evenly to 1/8,outkicked,clear 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Perfectly Julie
ENTRY.OWNER: Meister Richard Orsi Bernardo and Schmitt George F
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,3wide,drifted out turn,4wide upper,no late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Lucy Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up,bid 1/4,clear 1/8,kept to task stretch,held clearly

ENTRY.NAME: Her Perfect Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed speed,drifted out 4wide turn,chased stretch,faded late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOBBY'S GENIE was prominent in the early going and raced close to the solid early pace, pressed GENTLE JULIA into the turn then took command while two wide nearing the quarter pole, drew to a clear lead while under moderate urging to the furlong pole, pulled away nearing the sixteenth-marker and was hand ridden to the finish. GENTLE JULIA broke alertly and assumed command leaving the start, showed good early speed and set a pressured pace into the turn, was overtaken by BOBBY'S GENIE nearing the quarter marker, tipped two wide and chased the winner into the drive, was no match for the winner in the final stages and bested the rest. REALLY SATISFYING chased the solid early pace while inside of an outer rival, was coaxed along three wide into the stretch, lacked a final response and held clearly in the end for the show. DIVINE PASSAGE bobbled at the start and was off a step slowly, chased the solid early pace while outside of a rival, came four wide into the stretch and did not threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Gentle Julia
ENTRY.OWNER: Orsi Bernardo and Schmitt George F
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly,showed speed,no match for winner,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Really Satisfying
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2wide,3wide into stretch,no final kick,clear 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Bobby's Genie
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up,bid 2wide 1/4,clear 1/8,pulled away,hand urged late

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Passage
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start,chased outside,4wide into stretch,no threat

SCRATCH.NAME: Im in It to Win It

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 4 5F Turf CR: 101. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 27000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $15,000 ONCE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $32,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $32,000 (Cal Bred or Cal Sired Horses that have won the Open First Condition Allowance Race in Northern California must carry an Additional 2 lbs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUEEN MOLOTOV broke out a step at the start, showed speed and took command in the early going, set a quick pace into the turn then opened to a clear lead along the bend, was given a few reminder taps at mid-stretch, drew away in the final sixteenth and was geared down late as much the best. AIR FORCE WOMAN broke alertly, contested the early pace with QUEEN MOLOTOV but could not go on with that rival in the early going and chased to the turn, ran in pursuit of QUEEN MOLOTOV to the quarter marker, was not able to make headway on the winner in the drive and held safely for second at the finish. MISS LIZZY chased the fast early pace from the inside, ran evenly to mid-stretch, could not muster the needed late response and was outfinished for the place, while holding clearly for the show. CITY GLITTER lacked early speed, was coaxed along three wide into the turn, swung four wide for the stretch drive and did not factor. TIP TOP GAL chased the solid early pace while outside of a rival, lost position into the turn and gave chase while two wide nearing the quarter marker, weakened in upper stretch and did not offer a late response.

ENTRY.NAME: City Glitter
ENTRY.OWNER: Martin, Jerry R. and Margaret M.
ENTRY.COMMENT: lacked early speed,3wide turn,4wide stretch,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Lizzy
ENTRY.OWNER: Glenn Sorgenstein WC Racing Inc and Wonderland Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,evenly to 1/8,needed more late,clear for 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Air Force Woman
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly,chased 2wide,no match for winner,held safely 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Tip Top Gal
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,2wide turn,weakened,no late response

ENTRY.NAME: Queen Molotov
ENTRY.OWNER: Stewball Stable Smolich Rob and Thomas Jamey R
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,showed speed,clear 1/4,drew away stretch,geared down

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LILA AT THE BEACH broke well and engaged in a speed duel outside of MO TOWN GAL, was well handled to the far turn, got the better of that rival passing the quarter pole then was challenged to the outside and briefly passed by THREAD COUNT at the top of the stretch, gamely came back on in the final furlong and prevailed in a gutsy effort. THREAD COUNT bumped by TIME TO SMILE after the break, settled to the rear of the compact field for the backstretch run, made steady forward progress through the turn, bid for and took a brief lead at the top of the stretch then was outfinished by a resurgent LILA AT THE BEACH in the final furlong. MO TOWN GAL was aggressively handled from the break, dueled with LILA AT THE BEACH through the turn, gave way near the quarter pole and came up empty in the drive. TIME TO SMILE broke out at the start, making light contact with THREAD COUNT, raced close up in the early stages then dropped off the pace going past the half mile marker, was passed by THREAD COUNT going into the turn then could do no better than chase the field home in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Town Gal
ENTRY.OWNER: Auyeung Nin Hauck Cheryl Miller Todd O'Brien Patricia and Taylor Marilyn
ENTRY.COMMENT: aggressively handled, inside, dueled to 5/16, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Lila At the Beach
ENTRY.OWNER: Smolich Andy Smolich Jim Smolich Rob and Wood Chris
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke well, dueled in hand, led, passed stretch, came back on

ENTRY.NAME: Time to Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, close up early struggled near 1/2, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Thread Count
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumed break, reserved early, bid turn, brief lead, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 96. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming, And Starter Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility And Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEA OF LIBERTY settled off of the solid early pace, tracked the pacesetter through the backstretch run while outside of GROWTH ENGINE, raced in tandem with that rival into the far turn, came three wide for the drive, overtook the tiring pacesetter in upper stretch and met the bid of GROWTH ENGINE at the furlong marker while inside of that foe, dueled gamely to the final sixteenth, responded to firm urging in deep stretch and determinedly prevailed at the wire. GROWTH ENGINE rated off of the solid early pace, tracked from the second flight and raced outside of an inner rival through the backstretch run, was coaxed along three wide into the far turn and was roused four wide into the stretch, drew to even terms with SEA OF LIBERTY nearing the furlong marker, dueled with the determined winner into deep stretch and was gamely bested in the final strides. WELLSWORT (IRE) was squeezed leaving the start and was away a bit slowly, settled in the second flight along the first turn and tracked the solid pace while outside of rivals through the backstretch run, raced three wide to the quarter marker, rallied in upper stretch and came within aim approaching the furlong marker, could not offer a final response in deep stretch and was outkicked, while well clear for the show. SUGAR BEETS bobbled leaving the start and was off a bit slowly, was allowed to settle in the early running, maintained a two wide path through the backstretch run, improved position along the far turn, offered a bid approaching mid-stretch but could not sustain that run in the final stages and weakened. GALLANT WARREN was unhurried in the early running and lagged through the backstretch run, saved ground into the far turn then swung four wide for the stretch drive, gained ground heading to the furlong marker, finished evenly in the final stages and passed tiring rivals in deep stretch. MO THEM DOWN was asked for early speed and assumed command leaving the break, drew to a clear lead into the backstretch run and dictated terms while carving fast fractions to the half-mile marker, held a long lead to the quarter pole, was overtaken in upper stretch and faded through the final furlong. BRONZE WARRIOR tracked the solid early pace, saved ground through the backstretch run, lacked a response along the far turn and tired in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Growth Engine
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated off pace,tracked 2wide,bid 4wide 1/4,dueled stretch,gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Bronze Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace,2wide-inside,asked 1/4,tired stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Beets
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start,settled 2wide,bid 1/8,failed to sustain bid

ENTRY.NAME: Sea of Liberty
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked outside,3wide bid,met bid,dueled,determinedly prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Wellswort (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start,tracked outside,bid 3wide 1/4,outkicked stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Them Down
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent,set solid pace,long lead 1/4,overtaken 3/16,faded stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Gallant Warren
ENTRY.OWNER: Bellasis Tim Brogan Patrick O'Leary Timothy Francis and Tschanz Cassandra A
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried,swung 4wide stretch,bid 1/8,evenly late,by tired foes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SANTA ROSA RACE 7 5F Turf CR: 84. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORMING MACHINE broke well, pressed the pace outside of ATTA BOY LLOYD while always traveling well, took command passing the quarter pole, drew off to an open lead, finished strong and was never threatened. GODSEND was under a ride from the break, found a good rhythm heading to the three furlong marker, gradually cut into the leading margin of the dueling leaders then finished up well under left handed urging to gain second while slowly gaining on, but never a threat to the winner. ATTA BOY LLOYD got squeezed at the start then was being leaned on by STORMING MACHINE for a few strides, recovered, then set off for the lead, was joined by that foe to the outside, dueled through the turn racing away from the rail, jumped a rough patch in the turn near the five-sixteenths pole causing a slight loss of momentum, weakened in the stretch but ran on well enough to hold the third spot. GALLO DEL CIELO was outrun from the break, chased the field through the turn, tipped out a path into the stretch and finished with some late interest while racing greenly. MAVERICK ROSE veered out from the break and was extremely wide in the early stages, moved closer going into the turn then drifted out, came under pressure from the quarter pole but could not make up any ground late and was tiring before the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Gallo Del Cielo
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, chased field to turn, tipped out stretch, green

ENTRY.NAME: Godsend
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden from break, middle move, ran on well for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Atta Boy Lloyd
ENTRY.OWNER: Kelly Benjamin E and Taylor Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, dueled inside, jumped patches turn, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Storming Machine
ENTRY.OWNER: Pine Racing Stables Talla Racing LLC and West Point Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace in hand, bid 1/4, opened up, never threatened

ENTRY.NAME: Maverick Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered sharply break, drifted turn, no impact late
